texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Java applications are notoriously unpredictable and Wayland takes unpredictability to the next level. One particular application on my desktop always seems to start with massive cursors.
texts.text: Java applications are notoriously unpredictable and Wayland takes unpredictability to the next level. One particular application on my desktop always seems to start with massive cursors.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: This post is about how I fixed and then discovered something interesting along the way.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Fixing big cursors
texts.text: Fixing big cursors

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I recently moved some investment and trading accounts from TD Ameritrade to  Tastytrade . Both offer Java applications that make trading easier, but Tastytrade's application always started with massive cursors.
texts.text: I recently moved some investment and trading accounts from TD Ameritrade to  Tastytrade . Both offer Java applications that make trading easier, but Tastytrade's application always started with massive cursors.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: To make matters worse, sometimes the cursor looked lined up on the screen but then the click landed on the wrong buttons in the application! Errors are annoying. Errors that cost you money and time must be fixed. 😜
texts.text: To make matters worse, sometimes the cursor looked lined up on the screen but then the click landed on the wrong buttons in the application! Errors are annoying. Errors that cost you money and time must be fixed. 😜

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Some web searches eventually led me to Arch Linux's excellent  Wayland wiki page . None of the adjustments or environment variables there had any effect on my cursors.
texts.text: Some web searches eventually led me to Arch Linux's excellent  Wayland wiki page . None of the adjustments or environment variables there had any effect on my cursors.

texts.text:

texts.orig: systemd does everything 😆
texts.text: systemd does everything 😆

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: After more searching and digging, I discovered that systemd has a capability to  set environment variables for user sessions :
texts.text: After more searching and digging, I discovered that systemd has a capability to  set environment variables for user sessions :

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Configuration files in the environment.d/ directories contain lists of environment variable assignments passed to services started by the systemd user instance. systemd-environment-d-generator(8) parses them and updates the environment exported by the systemd user instance. See below for an discussion of which processes inherit those variables.
texts.text: Configuration files in the environment.d/ directories contain lists of environment variable assignments passed to services started by the systemd user instance. systemd-environment-d-generator(8) parses them and updates the environment exported by the systemd user instance. See below for an discussion of which processes inherit those variables.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: It is recommended to use numerical prefixes for file names to simplify ordering.
texts.text: It is recommended to use numerical prefixes for file names to simplify ordering.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: For backwards compatibility, a symlink to /etc/environment is installed, so this file is also parsed.
texts.text: For backwards compatibility, a symlink to /etc/environment is installed, so this file is also parsed.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Let's give that a try:
texts.text: Let's give that a try:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
$ mkdir -p ~/.config/environment.d/
$ vim ~/.config/environment.d/wayland.conf
texts.text:
$ mkdir -p ~/.config/environment.d/
$ vim ~/.config/environment.d/wayland.conf

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: In the file, I added one line with a comment (because you will soon forget why you added it 😄):
texts.text: In the file, I added one line with a comment (because you will soon forget why you added it 😄):

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# Fix big cursors in Java apps in Wayland
XCURSOR_SIZE=16
texts.text:
# Fix big cursors in Java apps in Wayland
XCURSOR_SIZE=16

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: After a reboot, I launched my Java application and boom -- the cursors were perfect!  🎉
texts.text: After a reboot, I launched my Java application and boom -- the cursors were perfect!  🎉
